intro: Hibbertia virgata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. It has smooth, often hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Hibbertia virgata var. glabra is a perennial shrub that produces small, fleshy fruits following the flowering season.
